alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 30 at 2:03AM PDT until April 02 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 19 to 43 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Oregon Cascades and Cascades in Lane County. In Washington, South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for significant snow accumulations in and near the Watch area that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
